content.title: Financial Assistance For Allied Cultural Activities
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Allied Cultural Activities' was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. This scheme is a sub-component of the scheme component 'Financial Assistance for Building Grants Including Studio Theatres' under 'Scheme of Financial Assistance for Creation of Cultural Infrastructure'. The objective of this scheme sub-component is to provide financial assistance for the creation of assets for enhancing the audio-visual spectacle for allied cultural activities to give first-hand experience of live performances on a regular basis and during festivals in open/closed areas/spaces where large numbers of tourists/visitors come regularly and during major events/festivals the number of visitors swells to lakhs.
benefits: Maximum assistance under the scheme component, including applicable duties & taxes and also Operation & Maintenance (O&M) costing for five years, will be as under: (i) Audio: ₹100 Lakh; (ii) Audio + Video: ₹150 Lakh.
All grants under the scheme will be of a non-recurring nature.
Assistance under this component to an organization will be restricted to a maximum of 90% (including taxes and duties) of the approved estimated project cost along with five years of O&M costs.
eligibility: All not-for-profit organizations who are engaged for at least for past three years in presenting the spectacle for allied cultural activities.
The organization is registered as a society under the Registration of Societies Act (XXI of 1860) or similar Acts, or as a Trust or as a Not-for-Profit Company, at least for a period of three years.
documents_required: Project Report/Proposal including organization’s profile, project description, cost estimates, sources of finance, time schedule, and post-completion plan.
Copy of the Certificate of Registration under the Societies Registration Act, 1860.
Copy of the Memorandum of Association (or Trust Deed) of the organization.
List of present members of the Board of Management/Office Bearers/Trustees.
Copies of Annual Accounts for the last three financial years.
Documentary evidence in support of the claim for matching share.
Resolution of the Board of Management authorizing a person to sign the application.
A Bond for the assistance sought.
Copy of active Unique ID Number obtained from NGO Darpan Portal.
Copy of the PAN Card of the grantee organization.
A Bank Authorization letter showing ECS details of the Bank Account.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance for the creation of assets for enhancing the audio-visual spectacle for allied cultural activities.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this scheme centrally sponsored?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is centrally sponsored.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Maximum assistance under the scheme component will be ₹100 Lakh for Audio and ₹150 Lakh for Audio + Video.

faqs.question: Which type of organization is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: All not-for-profit organizations engaged for at least three years in presenting the spectacle for allied cultural activities.
